intro: Mesosphaerum glechomodes, commonly known as the false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Mesosphaerum glechomodes is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
